noun.description: The identification of the nature of an illness or other problem by examination of the symptoms.
examples: early diagnosis and treatment are essential
a diagnosis of Crohn's disease was made

noun.description: The distinctive characterization in precise terms of a genus, species, or phenomenon.

origin: Late 17th century: modern Latin, from Greek, from diagignōskein distinguish, discern, from dia apart + gignōskein recognize, know.
